title: Fragment of a Latin inscription

support._: Fragment of a marble plaque, broken on all sides. The plaque originally bore a monumental Latin inscription on the reverse (, with the trace of a moulding on along the broken lower edge, and was subsequently re-used for this text

layout.p: A single line of crudely incised Latin letters, with two faintly incised horizontal lines running across the face some distance below the text.

handNote.lettering: Curdely cut letters with basic serifs on some strokes; the mid-strokes of the M only descen halfway.

date._: later Roman, after the second century BCE

provenanceFound._: Schubring in his autopsy notes of 1865 for the inscription on the obverse (no.144) states that the piece was found in the area of the great altar of Hieron; Mommsen in CIL states that it was found by Serradifaclo among the ruins of the great altar (but does not reference the source for this claim). Found with ISic000417.

museum.name: Museo Archeologico Regionale Paolo Orsi
museum.description: An outstanding collection of archaeological material. The collection ranges from Siracusa and the surrounding territory (Megara Hyblaia, Akrai, Kasmenai etc) to encompass all of eastern Sicily, reaching as far as Gela and Agrigento. The ground floor covers prehistory through to the end of the Classical period. Upstairs includes Hellenistic and Roman Syracuse and a display of material from the catacombs. A gallery displaying material from Hellenistic eastern Sicily is in preparation.

bibl.author: Orsi
